intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. pantotrichum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow flowers that are surrounded by a ring of bracts, and its leaves are usually hairy, giving it its common name. The subspecies pantotrichum is distinguished by its dense, hairy foliage and its ability to thrive in a variety of habitats.
